input_text:
Job Title: Sr Enterprise Project Manager

Location: Texas, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
As the nation's largest community credit union, we begin every day focused on delivering superior financial products and services for our 1.3 million members and more than $30 billion in managed assets. Our work has an economic impact as we support our members' financial goals. We are unapologetic about being devoted to our members and the communities we serve. Our business is guided by our people helping people philosophy – which includes our team members.

BECU has been in business for more than 85 years, driven by unwavering core values and a dedication to improving the communities we serve. While we have a rich history, the future of our company, accelerated by business and technology transformation, is even brighter. There's never been a better time to work for BECU.

To learn more visit becu.org/careers.

PAY RANGE

The Target Pay Range for this position is $122,000-$149,100 annually. The full Pay Range is $94,500-$176,500 annually. At BECU, compensation decisions are determined using factors such as relevant job-related skills, experience, and education or training. Should an offer for employment be made, we will consider individual qualifications. In addition to your salary, compensation incentives are available for the hired applicant. Incentives are performance based and targets vary by role.

Benefits

Employees and their eligible family members have access to a wide array of employee benefits, such as medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage. Employees have access to disability and AD&D insurance. We also offer health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts, as well as health savings accounts, to eligible employees. Employees are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan and employer-funded retirement plan. Newly hired employees accrue 6.16 hours of paid time off (PTO) on a per pay period basis based on hours worked (up to a maximum of 160 PTO hours per year) and receive ten paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Additional details regarding BECU Benefits can be found here.

Impact You’ll Make

The Sr. Enterprise Project Manager will play a critical role in leading and managing the successful completion of highly complex enterprise-wide technology projects, features, and initiatives related to the various business units within the Credit Union. Your contributions will directly impact the execution, planning, and closure of these projects, and you will collaborate with people at all levels of the organization to ensure business outcomes and project scope are defined and documented.

What You’ll Do

Ensure Appropriate Project Governance: Ensure that the project is governed properly within the organization’s framework.Define and Document Business Outcomes/Objectives and Project Scope: Clearly define and document the business outcomes/objectives and project scope in line with the Credit Union's objectives.Lead and Implement Projects: Lead the project team in the successful planning, execution, and implementation of application development and application modernization projects/programs, from initiation through project closure.Develop Work Plans: Create work plans for complex or specialized technology projects, features, and business initiatives.Follow Prescribed Project Management Methodologies: Adhere to the prescribed project management methodologies including Agile and Waterfall, on all projects.Manage Project Artifacts and Financials: Ensure all project artifacts are documented and manage project financials including creating a budget and forecast.Manage Resource Plan and External Activities: Create and manage a resource plan for project(s) and manage the activities of external partners and resources working on assigned projects.Collaborate and Manage Dependencies: Collaborate, communicate, and manage dependencies with other teams and remove impediments to clear the path for the team to work.Risk Management and Communication: Manage risks and issues throughout the project lifecycle and ensure consistent and timely communication regarding project status, issues, and risks.Facilitate Release Plans and Go-Live Activities: Facilitate the creation and management of release plans, go-live activities, and support.Continuous Improvement and Team Environment: Continuously improve project delivery throughout the lifecycle and create a positive and collaborative work environment for project team(s).Enterprise PMO Processes: Contribute to the continuous improvement of Enterprise PMO processes.

What You’ll Gain

Opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of BECU Chance to elevate your career and skills while making a significant impact Collaborative and innovative team environment Chance to contribute to the robust technological landscape of BECU 

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in business or computer science or equivalent work or educational experience.Minimum of 7 years’ experience leading projects or serving in a project management type of role. Experience must include management of enterprise-wide projects.Demonstrated ability to creatively solve problems and remove obstacles from the project path.Demonstrated leadership, negotiation, and project management skills.Demonstrated conceptual, organizational, analytical, and critical thinking skills.

Desired Qualifications

Advanced degree preferred.Experience managing cloud projects/programs, preferably Azure.Experience managing projects that involved product creation.Experience working with third party integration partners.10 years of experience leading projects preferred.Project management certifications, e.g. PMP, and relevant education from organizations such as the Project Management Institute or universities, preferred.

JOIN THE JOURNEY

Ready to make an indelible impact? Eager to be a part of a collaborative and innovative team where your ideas and contributions don’t just fill a role, but fuel the growth and success of BECU? Embrace the opportunity to grow with us. Apply now, bring your expertise to the table, and let’s achieve excellence together at BECU. Your journey of influence, innovation, and impactful contribution starts now. #BECU #YourGrowth #BECUJourney

EEO Statement

BECU is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.summary: Lead and manage successful enterprise-wide technology projects, ensuring alignment with Credit Union objectives.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in business or computer science

Facilitate release plans and go-live activities
Contribute to continuous improvement of Enterprise PMO processes

Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
output_json.company_information: BECU is a community credit union with over 1.3 million members and $30 billion in managed assets. It focuses on delivering superior financial products and services, supports member financial goals, and contributes to community improvement.
